intro: Adina rubrostipulata var. discolor, commonly known as the red-stippled adina, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red-veined leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval with prominent reddish markings along the veins. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage.
